DataElement.preferredName: Upper Gastrointestinal Tract Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Persistent Nausea Vomiting Anorexia Positive Upper Gastrointestinal Tract Biopsy Observed Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not the upper part of the gastrointestinal tract

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Upper Gastrointestinal Tract Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Persistent Nausea Vomiting Anorexia Positive Upper Gastrointestinal Tract Biopsy Observed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The upper part of the gastrointestinal tract that includes the esophagus, stomach, and duodenum._A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, usually affecting the skin, liver, and GI tract. The onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._Retained; never-ceasing._A disorder characterized by a queasy sensation and/or the urge to vomit._A disorder characterized by the reflexive act of ejecting the contents of the stomach through the mouth._A disorder characterized by a loss of appetite._Confirmation of something, such as a positive lab test. In medicine, a positive lab test indicates the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism. (NCI)_The upper part of the gastrointestinal tract that includes the esophagus, stomach, and duodenum._The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis._Ascertained or determined through monitoring or observation.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Upper Gastrointestinal Tract Acute Graft Versus Host Disease
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The upper part of the gastrointestinal tract that includes the esophagus, stomach, and duodenum.:A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, usually affecting the skin, liver, and GI tract. The onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

Concepts.definition: The upper part of the gastrointestinal tract that includes the esophagus, stomach, and duodenum.

A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, usually affecting the skin, liver, and GI tract. The onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

Property.preferredName: Persistent Nausea Vomiting Anorexia Positive Upper Gastrointestinal Tract Biopsy Observed
Property.preferredDefinition: Retained; never-ceasing.:A disorder characterized by a queasy sensation and/or the urge to vomit.:A disorder characterized by the reflexive act of ejecting the contents of the stomach through the mouth.:A disorder characterized by a loss of appetite.:Confirmation of something, such as a positive lab test. In medicine, a positive lab test indicates the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism. (NCI):The upper part of the gastrointestinal tract that includes the esophagus, stomach, and duodenum.:The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.:Ascertained or determined through monitoring or observation.

Concepts.definition: A disorder characterized by a queasy sensation and/or the urge to vomit.
A disorder characterized by the reflexive act of ejecting the contents of the stomach through the mouth.
A disorder characterized by a loss of appetite.
Confirmation of something, such as a positive lab test. In medicine, a positive lab test indicates the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism. (NCI)
The upper part of the gastrointestinal tract that includes the esophagus, stomach, and duodenum.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.
Ascertained or determined through monitoring or observation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
